edu.caltech.sbw
Class SBWLog

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--grace.log.Log
        |
        +--edu.caltech.sbw.SBWLog
All Implemented Interfaces:
Distributer, Remote
public class SBWLog
extends Log

This is a specialization of the grace.log package. All of the Log.* methods from that package are applicable, and in addition, SBWLog defines some additional methods and features useful for SBW.

Version:
$Revision: 1.2 $
Author:
Michael Hucka, $Author: mhucka $

Constructor Detail

SBWLog

public SBWLog()
Method Detail

trace

public static final void trace()
Overrides grace.log.Log.trace() so that the static final boolean flag ConfigVars.TRACING can be used to control whether the tracing calls are included in compiled code. This permits us to use tracing freely in SBW, and still avoid a performance penalty by setting ConfigVars.TRACING to false in production code and having optimizing compilers remove the calls altogether.

From the documentation of grace.log.Log.trace(): This function makes an entry in the log device that indicates the programtic position of the caller. Typically this will include the filename and line number and could also include the class name and function name. This is equivalent to calling the log function with "trace" as the event type.

trace

public static final void trace(String message)
Overrides grace.log.Log.trace() so that the static final boolean flag ConfigVars.TRACING can be used to control whether the tracing calls are included in compiled code. This permits us to use tracing freely in SBW, and still avoid a performance penalty by setting ConfigVars.TRACING to false in production code and having optimizing compilers remove the calls altogether.

From the documentation of grace.log.Log.trace(): This function writes the given message in the log device and makes an entry in the log device that indicates the programtic position of the caller. Typically this will include the filename and line number and could also include the class name and function name. This is equivalent to calling the log function with "trace" as the event type.

Parameters:
message - a string representing the message to log

trace

public static final void trace(Object object)
Overrides grace.log.Log.trace() so that the static final boolean flag ConfigVars.TRACING can be used to control whether the tracing calls are included in compiled code. This permits us to use tracing freely in SBW, and still avoid a performance penalty by setting ConfigVars.TRACING to false in production code and having optimizing compilers remove the calls altogether.

From the documentation of grace.log.Log.trace(): This function writes the given object in the log device and makes an entry in the log device that indicates the programtic position of the caller. Typically this will include the filename and line number and could also include the class name and function name. Both the object and the trace message are specific to the log implementation. This is equivalent to calling the log function with "trace" as the event type.

Parameters:
object - to log in implementation specific manner

exception

public static void exception(Throwable throwable)
Similar to SBWLog.error(), except designed to handle Exceptions and Throwables (and with special handling of SBWException objects). Exceptions are treated as grace.log "error" events.

From the documentation of grace.log.Log.error(): This logs the given message along with the given exception. The format and that extent the exception is logged is dependent on the particular implementation of the log. This is equivalent to calling the log function with "error" as the event type.

Parameters:
throwable - the exception or throwable to report

exception

public static void exception(String context,
                             Throwable throwable)
Similar to SBWLog.error(), except designed to handle Exceptions and Throwables (and with special handling of SBWException objects). Exceptions are treated as grace.log "error" events.

From the documentation of grace.log.Log.error(): This logs the given message along with the given exception. The format and that extent the exception is logged is dependent on the particular implementation of the log. This is equivalent to calling the log function with "error" as the event type.

Parameters:
context - descriptive message to be logged to the log device
throwable - the exception or throwable to report

error

public static void error(String message)
This logs the indicated error message text to the configured log device. This is equivalent to calling the log function with "error" as the event type.

Error messages should indicate a grave condition in which the programmer can not anticipate the integrity of the running system.

Parameters:
message - to be logged to the log device

error

public static void error(String message,
                         Object object)
This logs the error message and then logs the given object. The format and extent that this object is logged is dependent on the particular implementation of the log. This is equivalent to calling the log function with "error" as the event type.

Error messages should indicate a grave condition in which the programmer can not anticipate the integrity of the running system.

Parameters:
message - to be logged to the log device
object - to be logged to log device in implementation specific manner.

error

public static void error(Exception exception)
This function simply logs the given exception to the log device. The format and that extent the exception is logged is dependent on the particular implementation of the log. This is equivalent to calling the log function with "error" as the event type.

Error messages should indicate a grave condition in which the programmer can not anticipate the integrity of the running system.

Parameters:
object - to be logged to log device in implementation specific manner.

error

public static void error(String message,
                         Exception exception)
This logs the given message along with the given exception. The format and that extent the exception is logged is dependent on the particular implementation of the log. This is equivalent to calling the log function with "error" as the event type.

Error messages should indicate a grave condition in which the programmer can not anticipate the integrity of the running system.

warning

public static void warning(String message)
This logs the indicated warning message text to the configured log device. This is equivalent to calling the log function with "warning" as the event type.

Warning messages should indicate a problem in the system but one which the programmer expects will not affect the immediate integrity of the running system.

Parameters:
message - to log

warning

public static void warning(String message,
                           Object object)
This logs the indicated warning message text and object to the configured log device. The format of the object in the log is specific to the particular log implmentation. This is equivalent to calling the log function with "warning" as the event type.

Warning messages should indicate a problem in the system but one which the programmer expects will not affect the immediate integrity of the running system.

Parameters:
message - to log

warning

public static void warning(String message,
                           Exception exception)
This logs the indicated warning message text and give exception to the configured log device. The format of the object in the log is specific to the particular log implmentation. This is equivalent to calling the log function with "warning" as the event type.

Warning messages should indicate a problem in the system but one which the programmer expects will not affect the immediate integrity of the running system.

Parameters:
message - to be logged
exception - to be logged

notice

public static void notice(String message)
This logs the indicated notice message text to the configured log device. This is equivalent to calling the log function with "warning" as the event type.

Notices messages should be used to communicate situations that have developed that are part of the normal operation of the system. This is equivalent to calling the log function with "notice" as the event type.

Parameters:
message - to log

notice

public static void notice(String message,
                          Object object)
This logs the indicated notice message text and the given object to the configured log device. The object is written in an implmentation specific to the particular log device. This is equivalent to calling the log function with "notice" as the event type.

Notices messages should be used to communicate situations that have developed that are part of the normal operation of the system.

Parameters:
message - to log
object - to log in implementation specific format
